019package com.bewsoftware.utils.regexp;
020
021import java.util.regex.Pattern;
022
023import static java.util.regex.Pattern.CASE_INSENSITIVE;
024
025/**
026 * Pre-designed and tested regular expressions collected from many sources.
027 *
028 * @author <a href="mailto:bw.opensource@yahoo.com">Bradley Willcott</a>
029 *
030 * @since 1.0
031 * @version 1.0
032 */
033public enum Patterns {
034
035    /**
036     * Date in format dd/mm/yyyy.
037     * <p>
038     * Will match dates with dashes, slashes or with spaces (e.g. dd-mm-yyyy
039     * dd/mm/yyyy dd mm yyyy), and optional time separated by a space or a
040     * dash (e.g. dd-mm-yyyy-hh:mm:ss or dd/mm/yyyy hh:mm:ss).
041     * </p>
042     * <p>
043     * Source:
044     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
045     * </p>
046     */
047    DateTimeFormat("^(0?[1-9]|[12][0-9]|3[01])([ \\/\\-])(0?[1-9]|1[012])\\2([0-9][0-9][0-9][0-9])"
048                   + "(([ -])([0-1]?[0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5]?[0-9]:[0-5]?[0-9])?$", 0),
049    /**
050     * Date and time in ISO-8601 format.
051     * <p>
052     * Will match valid dates and times in the ISO-8601 format, excludes
053     * durations.
054     * </p>
055     * <p>
056     * Source:
057     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
058     * </p>
059     */
060    DateTime8601Format("^(?![+-]?\\d{4,5}-?(?:\\d{2}|W\\d{2})T)(?:|(\\d{4}|[+-]\\d{5})-?(?:|(0\\d|1[0-2])"
061                       + "(?:|-?([0-2]\\d|3[0-1]))|([0-2]\\d{2}|3[0-5]\\d|36[0-6])|W([0-4]\\d|5[0-3])(?:|-?([1-7])))"
062                       + "(?:(?!\\d)|T(?=\\d)))(?:|([01]\\d|2[0-4])(?:|:?([0-5]\\d)(?:|:?([0-5]\\d)(?:|\\.(\\d{3})))"
063                       + "(?:|[zZ]|([+-](?:[01]\\d|2[0-4]))(?:|:?([0-5]\\d)))))$", 0),
064    /**
065     * Find doubled words: the the.
066     */
067    DoubleWordRegex("\\b(\\w+)\\s+\\1\\b", CASE_INSENSITIVE),
068    /**
069     * Basic email format.
070     * <p>
071     * An email address format that must be in the following order: <br>
072     * characters@characters.domain <br>
073     * (characters followed by an @ sign, followed by more characters, and
074     * then a ".")
075     * </p>
076     * <p>
077     * Source:
078     * <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/att_input_pattern.asp">https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/att_input_pattern.asp</a>
079     * </p>
080     */
081    EmailFormat("[a-z0-9._%+-]+@[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,}$", CASE_INSENSITIVE),
082    /**
083     * Almost Perfect Email Regex.
084     * <p>
085     * General Email Regex (RFC 5322 Official Standard).
086     * </p>
087     * <p>
088     * Source:
089     * <a href="https://emailregex.com/">https://emailregex.com</a>
090     * </p>
091     */
092    EmailFormat2("(?:[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+(?:\\.[a-z0-9!#$%&'*+/=?^_`{|}~-]+)*"
093                 + "|\"(?:[\\x01-\\x08\\x0b\\x0c\\x0e-\\x1f\\x21\\x23-\\x5b\\x5d-\\x7f]"
094                 + "|\\\\[\\x01-\\x09\\x0b\\x0c\\x0e-\\x7f])*\")@(?:(?:[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?\\.)+"
095                 + "[a-z0-9](?:[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9])?|\\[(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]"
096                 + "|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?"
097                 + "|[a-z0-9-]*[a-z0-9]:(?:[\\x01-\\x08\\x0b\\x0c\\x0e-\\x1f\\x21-\\x5a\\x53-\\x7f]"
098                 + "|\\\\[\\x01-\\x09\\x0b\\x0c\\x0e-\\x7f])+)\\])", CASE_INSENSITIVE),
099    /**
100     * Hex Color Value.
101     * <p>
102     * RGB hex colors.
103     * </p>
104     * <p>
105     * Source:
106     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
107     * </p>
108     */
109    HexColourValue("^#?([a-fA-F0-9]{6}|[a-fA-F0-9]{3})$", 0),
110    /**
111     * <table>
112     * <caption>
113     * Named Groups
114     * </caption>
115     * <thead>
116     * <tr>
117     * <th>Group Name</th>
118     * <th></th>
119     * <th>Description</th>
120     * <th>Empty Value</th>
121     * </tr>
122     * </thead>
123     * <tbody>
124     * <tr>
125     * <td>endTag</td>
126     * <td>:</td>
127     * <td>Captures the '/' if this is an end tag</td>
128     * <td>null</td>
129     * </tr>
130     * <tr>
131     * <td>tagName</td>
132     * <td>:</td>
133     * <td>Captures TagName</td>
134     * <td >Required - never empty</td>
135     * </tr>
136     * <tr>
137     * <td>atts</td>
138     * <td>:</td>
139     * <td>Group attributes</td>
140     * <td>"" - Empty String</td>
141     * </tr>
142     * <tr>
143     * <td>att</td>
144     * <td>:</td>
145     * <td>A single attribute</td>
146     * <td>null</td>
147     * </tr>
148     * <tr>
149     * <td>attName</td>
150     * <td>:</td>
151     * <td>Attribute name</td>
152     * <td>null</td>
153     * </tr>
154     * <tr>
155     * <td>attVal1</td>
156     * <td>:</td>
157     * <td>"Double quoted" value string *</td>
158     * <td>null</td>
159     * </tr>
160     * <tr>
161     * <td>attVal2</td>
162     * <td>:</td>
163     * <td>'Single quoted' value string *</td>
164     * <td>null</td>
165     * </tr>
166     * <tr>
167     * <td>completeTag</td>
168     * <td>:</td>
169     * <td>Captures the '/' if this is a complete tag</td>
170     * <td>null</td>
171     * </tr>
172     * </tbody>
173     * </table>
174     * <p>
175     * <strong>Note: *</strong> Normally only <em>attVal1</em> will have content.
176     * </p>
177     */
178    HtmlTagRegex("<"
179                 // Captures the '/' if this is an end tag
180                 + "(?<endTag>/)?"
181                 // Captures TagName
182                 + "(?<tagName>\\w+)"
183                 // Group attributes
184                 + "(?<atts>"
185                 // A single attribute
186                 + "(?<att>\\s+"
187                 // Attribute name
188                 + "(?<attName>\\w+)"
189                 // Groups attribute '="value"' portion
190                 + "(\\s*=\\s*"
191                 // attVal1='double quoted'
192                 + "(?:\\x22(?<attVal1>[^\\x22]*)\\x22"
193                 // attVal2='single quoted'
194                 + "|'(?<attVal2>[^']*)')?"
195                 // End optional attribute '="value"' portion
196                 + ")?"
197                 // End attributes grouping
198                 + ")+\\s*"
199                 // Boolean attribute - No '="value"' portion
200                 + "|\\s*)?"
201                 // Captures the '/' if this is a complete tag
202                 + "(?<completeTag>/)?>",
203                 CASE_INSENSITIVE),
204    /**
205     * HTML tags.
206     * <p>
207     * Match opening and closing HTML tags with content between.
208     * </p>
209     * <p>
210     * Source:
211     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
212     * </p>
213     */
214    HtmlTags("<(?<tagName>[a-z1-6]+)(?<atts>([^<]+)*)?(?:>(?<text>[^<]*)?<\\/\\1>| *\\/>)", CASE_INSENSITIVE),
215    /**
216     *
217     */
218    HtmlTagsAtt("(?<attName>\\w+)" //Attribute name
219                + "(" //groups = value portion.
220                + "\\s*=\\s*" // =
221                + "(?:['\\x22])?"
222                + "(" //Groups attribute "value" portion.
223                + "(?<attVal>[^'\\x22]*" // attVal='quoted'
224                + "|[^'\\x22>\\s]+)" // attVal=urlnospaces
225                + ")" //end Groups attribute "value" portion
226                //                    + "(?:\\k<quote>)?"
227                + ")?", //end optional att value portion.
228                0),
229    /**
230     * SRC of image tag.
231     * <p>
232     * Match the src attribute of an HTML image tag.
233     * </p>
234     * <p>
235     * Source:
236     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
237     * </p>
238     */
239    ImageTagSRC("^<\\s*img[^>]+src\\s*=\\s*([\"'])(.*?)\\1[^>]*>$", CASE_INSENSITIVE),
240    /**
241     * IPv4 Address.
242     * <p>
243     * Match IP v4 addresses.
244     * </p>
245     * <p>
246     * Source:
247     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
248     * </p>
249     */
250    IPv4Address("^(?:(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)\\.){3}(?:25[0-5]|2[0-4][0-9]|[01]?[0-9][0-9]?)$", 0),
251    /**
252     * IPv6 Address.
253     * <p>
254     * Match IP v6 addresses.
255     * </p>
256     * <p>
257     * Source:
258     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
259     * </p>
260     */
261    IPv6Address("^(([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){7,7}[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,7}:"
262                + "|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,6}:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,5}(:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,2}"
263                + "|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,4}(:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,3}|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,3}(:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,4}"
264                + "|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,2}(:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,5}|[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:((:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,6})"
265                + "|:((:[0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}){1,7}|:)|fe80:(:[0-9a-fA-F]{0,4}){0,4}%[0-9a-zA-Z]{1,}"
266                + "|::(ffff(:0{1,4}){0,1}:){0,1}((25[0-5]|(2[0-4]|1{0,1}[0-9]){0,1}[0-9])\\.){3,3}(25[0-5]"
267                + "|(2[0-4]|1{0,1}[0-9]){0,1}[0-9])|([0-9a-fA-F]{1,4}:){1,4}:((25[0-5]|(2[0-4]"
268                + "|1{0,1}[0-9]){0,1}[0-9])\\.){3,3}(25[0-5]|(2[0-4]|1{0,1}[0-9]){0,1}[0-9]))$", 0),
269    /**
270     * Standard minimal password.
271     * <p>
272     * A password that must contain 8 or more characters that are of at
273     * least one number, and one uppercase and lowercase letter.
274     * </p>
275     * <p>
276     * Source:
277     * <a href="https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/att_input_pattern.asp">https://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/att_input_pattern.asp</a>
278     * </p>
279     */
280    Password("(?=.*\\d)(?=.*[a-z])(?=.*[A-Z]).{8,}", 0),
281    /**
282     * Time in 24-hour format.
283     * <p>
284     * Match times in 24 hour format.
285     * </p>
286     * <p>
287     * Source:
288     * <a href="https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub/">https://projects.lukehaas.me/regexhub</a>
289     * </p>
290     */
291    Time24HourFormat("^([01]?[0-9]|2[0-3]):[0-5][0-9]$", 0),
292    /**
293     * Matching a URL.
294     * <p>
295     * This regex is almost like taking the ending part of the above regex,
296     * slapping it between "http://" and some file structure at the end. It
297     * sounds a lot simpler than it really is. To start off, we search for
298     * the beginning of the line with the caret.
299     * </p><p>
300     * The first capturing group is all option. It allows the URL to begin
301     * with "http://", "https://", or neither of them. I have a question
302     * mark after the s to allow URL's that have http or https. In order to
303     * make this entire group optional, I just added a question mark to the
304     * end of it.
305     * </p><p>
306     * Next is the domain name: one or more numbers, letters, dots, or
307     * hypens followed by another dot then two to six letters or dots. The
308     * following section is the optional files and directories. Inside the
309     * group, we want to match any number of forward slashes, letters,
310     * numbers, underscores, spaces, dots, or hyphens. Then we say that this
311     * group can be matched as many times as we want. Pretty much this
312     * allows multiple directories to be matched along with a file at the
313     * end. I have used the star instead of the question mark because the
314     * star says zero or more, not zero or one. If a question mark was to be
315     * used there, only one file/directory would be able to be matched.
316     * </p><p>
317     * Then a trailing slash is matched, but it can be optional. Finally we
318     * end with the end of the line.
319     * </p><p>
320     * Source:
321     * <a href="https://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/8-regular-expressions-you-should-know--net-6149">
322     * https://code.tutsplus.com/tutorials/8-regular-expressions-you-should-know</a><p>
323     * <b>Note:</b> The regex pattern has been modified as follows:
324     * <br>
325     * <ul>
326     * <li>
327     * Added more protocols:
328     * <ul>
329     * <li>ftp</li>
330     * <li>file</li></ul></li>
331     * <li>
332     * Added Named Groups:
333     * ("{@code http://www.sample.com/this/directory/path/file.html}")
334     * <ul>
335     * <li>protocol: "{@code http}"</li>
336     * <li>website : "{@code www.sample.com}"</li>
337     * <li>filepath : "{@code /this/directory/path/file.html}"</li></ul></li>
338     * </ul>
339     */
340    URLFormat("^((?<protocol>https?|ftp|file):\\/\\/)?"
341              + "(?<website>([\\da-z\\.-]+)\\.([a-z\\.]{2,6}))"
342              + "(<filepath>([\\/\\w \\.-]*)*\\/?)$", CASE_INSENSITIVE);
343
344    /**
345     * Refer to the {@link java.util.regex.Pattern} class for the values
346     * stored here.
347     */
348    public final int flags;
349
350    /**
351     * The text of the regex.
352     */
353    public final String regex;
354
355    Patterns(String text, int options) {
356        this.regex = text;
357        this.flags = options;
358    }
359
360    /**
361     * Simple way of getting a compiled {@link Pattern} object.
362     * <p>
363     * Any flags stored with the regex, in {@link #flags} will be used in
364     * the compilation process.
365     * </p>
366     *
367     * @return new Pattern object with compiled regex.
368     */
369    public Pattern getPattern() {
370        return Pattern.compile(regex, flags);
371    }
372
373    /**
374     * Simple way of getting a compiled {@link Pattern} object.
375     * <p>
376     * Any flags stored with the regex in {@link #flags}, will be added to
377     * any value you supply through the {@code flags} parameter, and used in
378     * the compilation process.
379     * </p>
380     *
381     * @param flags Additional flags.
382     *
383     * @return new Pattern object with compiled regex.
384     */
385    public Pattern getPattern(int flags) {
386        return Pattern.compile(regex, this.flags | flags);
387    }
388
389    @Override
390    public String toString() {
391        return regex + " (" + flags + ")";
392    }
393}
